translation: This great poisonous herb and the medicine spirits are also the great peacock luminous king, the mother of all buddhas, who will guard me (someone) and my retinue for a hundred years, free of poison and harm.

source_sentence: 「復次阿難陀！
translation: "Furthermore, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 此佛母大孔雀明王教，七佛、正遍知、如來之所宣說，所謂：微鉢尸、尸棄、毘舍浮、羯句忖那、羯諾迦牟尼、迦葉波、我釋迦牟尼正遍知等，皆隨喜宣說此佛母大孔雀明王。
translation: This teaching of the great peacock king of illumination, the mother of all buddhas, was proclaimed by seven buddhas, correct omniscience, and tathāgatas, namely, Vipaśyin, Śikhin, Vaiśravaṇa, Kakuda-kauṇḍinya, Kanakamuni, Kāśyapa, and I, Śākyamuni, correct omniscience, who all delighted in proclaiming this great peacock king of illumination, the mother of all buddhas.

source_sentence: 慈氏菩薩亦隨喜宣說。
translation: The Compassionate Monk also delighted in proclaiming it.

source_sentence: 索訶世界主大梵天王，并天帝釋，四大天王，持國天王與揵達婆主，增長天王與俱槃茶主，廣目天王與龍主，多聞天王與藥叉主，并二十八大藥叉將，皆隨喜宣說此佛母大孔雀明王真言。
translation: The lord of the sohā world, the king of Brahmā, the emperor, the four great celestial kings, the king of the country-holding gods and the lord of gandharvas, the king of the growing gods and the lord of kumbhāṇḍas, the king of the wide-eyed gods and the lord of dragons, the king of the well-versed gods and the lord of yakṣas, and the twenty-eight great yakṣa generals all joyfully proclaimed this true teaching of the great peacock king of lights, the mother of all buddhas.

source_sentence: 散支迦大將，訶利底母及五百子，并諸眷屬，亦隨喜宣說。
translation: General Sanskrit, Mother Hāritī, her five hundred sons, and their retinues also joyfully proclaimed it.

source_sentence: 阿難陀！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 此佛母大孔雀明王真言，無能違越者。
translation: "This is the true teaching of the great peacock king of lights, the mother of buddhas, and there's nothing that can contradict it.

source_sentence: 若天、若龍、若阿蘇羅、麼嚕多、誐嚕拏、彥達嚩、緊那囉、摩護囉誐等，亦無能違越者。
translation: Nor can it be contradicted by gods, dragons, asuras, maladors, garuḍas, yandavas, kiṃnaras, mahoraga, and so forth.

source_sentence: 若藥叉、若羅剎娑、若畢[口*(隸-木+士)]多、比舍遮、步多、矩伴拏、布單那、羯吒布單那、塞建那、嗢麼那、車耶、阿鉢娑麼囉、塢娑跢羅迦等，一切鬼神亦無能違越者。
translation: Nor are there any yakṣas, rājasasas, piśācīs, puṣyatas, buddhas, khaṭapūtas, sakandhas, umānas, chāyas, apasamālās, or dasyāraka that all demons and spirits can disobey.

source_sentence: 及一切諸惡食者：食精氣者、食胎者、食血者、食肉者、食脂膏者、食髓者、食生者、食命者、食祭祠者、食氣者、食香者、食鬘者、食花者、食果者、食苗稼者、食火祭者、食膿者、食大便者、食小便者、食涕唾者、食涎者、食洟者、食殘食者、食吐者、食不淨物者、食漏水者，如是等諸惡食者，亦不能違越此佛母大孔雀明王。
translation: And all the bad food eaters: those who eat semen, those who eat womb, those who eat blood, those who eat meat, those who eat fat, those who eat marrow, those who eat birth, those who eat life, those who eat shrines, those who eat gas, those who eat incense, those who eat garlands, those who eat flowers, those who eat fruit, those who eat crops, those who eat fire sacrifices, those who eat pus, those who eat stool, those who eat urine, those who eat tears and spittle, those who eat saliva, those who eat mucus, those who eat leftover food, those who eat vomit, those who eat impure things, those who eat contaminated water, and so on, cannot transgress the great peacock luminous king, the mother of all buddhas.

source_sentence: 又諸蠱魅、厭禱、呪術，諸惡法者：訖[口*栗]底迦、羯麼拏、迦具[口*栗]那、枳刺拏、吠跢拏、質者、畢[口*(隸-木+士)]灑迦，亦不能違越。
translation: Nor can they transgress the spirits, disgusting prayers, spells, or bad dharmas like kṛtyā, khamana, kākuṭapāda, khārṣāṇa, vaiḍūla, sūrya, or piṭāsaka.

source_sentence: 又有飲他血髓，變人驅役，呼召鬼神，造諸惡業，惡食惡吐，惡影惡視，或造厭書，惡跳惡驀，或惡冐逆，作惡事者，亦不能違越此佛母大孔雀明王。
translation: Nor can they transgress the great peacock luminous king, the mother of all buddhas, who drinks the marrow of others, transforms people into servants, summons spirits, creates bad karma, eats badly, vomits badly, looks badly, creates distasteful writing, jumps badly, has bad flings, goes into a frenzy, or does bad deeds.

source_sentence: 又諸王賊水火、他兵飢饉、非時夭壽、地動惡獸、怨敵惡友等，亦不能違越，悉皆遠離。
translation: Nor can they transgress the kings, thieves, fire, other soldiers, famine, premature death, earthquakes, and enemies, nor can they avoid bad friends.

source_sentence: 又諸惡病：疥癩瘡癬、痔漏癰疽、身皮黑澁、飲食不消、頭痛半痛、眼耳鼻痛、脣口頰痛、牙齒舌痛、及咽喉痛、胸脅背痛、心肚腰胯、及脾膝痛、手足四支、及隱密處痛、瘦病乾消、遍身疼痛，如是等痛，亦不能違越，皆得遠離。
translation: Also, there are bad diseases: scabies, sores, ringworm, hemorrhoids, abscesses, black skin, lack of consumption, headaches and half-aches, pain in the eyes and ears and nose, pain in the mouth and lips, pain in the teeth and tongue, pain in the throat, pain in the chest and back, pain in the heart, stomach, waist, hips, spleen, and knees, pain in the four limbs of the hands and feet and in the hidden places, leprosy, dryness, and pain throughout the body, and so forth, which are all unsurpassed and can be avoided.

source_sentence: 又諸瘧病：一日二日、三日四日，乃至七日、半月一月，或復頻日、或復須臾，或常熱病，偏邪癭病，鬼神壯熱，風黃痰癊，或三集病，四百四病，皆不能違越此佛母大孔雀明王。
translation: Also, the malaria that strikes two days a day, three days, four days, seven days, half a month, one month, more frequent days, or a short time, the constant fever, the burdens of partiality, the fever of ghosts and spirits, the wind, yellow phlegm, and phlegm, the three episodes of illness, and the four hundred and four illnesses can't be overcome by the Great Peacock King, the mother of all buddhas.

source_sentence: 「阿難陀！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 復有鬼魅、人非人等，諸惡毒害，一切不祥，及諸惡病，一切鬼神，并及使者，怨敵恐怖，種種諸毒，及以呪術，一切厭禱，皆不能違越此摩訶摩瑜利佛母明王，常得遠離一切善不之業，獲大吉祥，眾聖加持，所求滿足。
translation: "Furthermore, demons, humans and non-humans, harmful poisons, all ill fortune, bad diseases, all spirits, messengers, enemies, fears, various poisons, spells, and all sorts of loathsome prayers cannot defeat this Mahāmayūri, the mother of all buddhas, who is always free of all good and bad actions and attains great good fortune, the support of sages, and the fulfillment of their desires.

source_sentence: 「復次阿難陀！
translation: "Furthermore, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若有人纔稱念，此摩訶摩瑜利佛母明王名字者，便護自身及護他人。
translation: "If someone even slightly calls to mind the name of this Mahāmayūri, the mother of all buddhas, they'll protect themselves and protect others.

source_sentence: 或結線索身上帶持，如其此人，應合死罪以罰物得脫，應合被罰輕杖得脫，應合輕杖被罵得脫，應合被罵自然得脫，一切苦難悉皆消散。
translation: He might wrap a cord around his body and carry it, so that this person is freed from a capital offense with a punishment, freed from a light stick with a punishment, freed from a light stick with a rebuke, and freed from a rebuke naturally, and all his suffering and hardships are all dispelled.

source_sentence: 此人亦不被王賊水火、惡毒刀杖之所侵害，人天鬼神無敢違越，睡安覺安，離諸恐怖，福德增長，壽命延長。
translation: That person also won't be harmed by kings, thieves, fire, or the vicious sword, and neither humans, gods, nor spirits will dare to disobey them. They experience restful sleep and peaceful awakening, are free of fear, and their fortune increases and their life span increases.

source_sentence: 「阿難陀！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 唯除宿世定業必受報者，但讀誦此經，必獲應効。
translation: Except for those who are bound to receive the results of their past lives' determined actions, simply reciting this sūtra will surely be effective.

source_sentence: 「阿難陀！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若天旱時，及雨澇時，讀誦此經，諸龍歡喜，若滯雨即晴，若亢旱必雨，令彼求者，隨意滿足。
translation: If you recite this sūtra when the sky is dry or when rain is abundant, the dragons rejoice, and if the rain is stagnant, it will clear up, or if it's extremely dry, it will rain, causing those who seek it to do as they please.

source_sentence: 「阿難陀！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 此佛母大孔雀明王，纔憶念者，能除恐怖怨敵，一切厄難，何況具足讀誦受持，必獲安樂。
translation: A little remembrance of this great peacock luminous king, the mother of buddhas, can remove fears and enemies and all difficulties, not to mention that perfect recitation and upholding it will surely bring well-being.

source_sentence: 「阿難陀！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 此摩訶摩瑜利佛母明王，是能除災禍、息怨敵者，為欲守護四眾——苾芻、苾芻尼、鄔波索迦、鄔波斯迦——離諸怖畏故。」
translation: This Mahāmayūri, the mother of all buddhas, is the one who can remove calamity and quell enemies in order to guard the four groups of people - the bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsaka, and upāsikā - from fears."

source_sentence: 復說真言曰：「怛儞也(二合)佗(引)(一)　野嚩底(二)　馱(引)[寧*頁](三)　馱囉枳(四)　矩嚕覩嚕銘(五)　娑嚩(二合、引)賀(引)(六)「貪欲瞋恚癡，　　是世間三毒，　諸佛皆已斷，　　實語毒消除。
translation: Again, he spoke the true words, "Tānaya (binary) tuṣita (citation needed)(1) dhāraṇī (2) dhāraṇī (3) dhāraṇī (4) kuruṇḍu (5) svāhā (binary)(citation needed)(6), 'Craving, anger, ill-will, and delusion are the three poisons of the world that the buddhas have stopped, and the poison of true speech is removed.'

source_sentence: 貪欲瞋恚癡，　　是世間三毒，　達磨皆已斷，　　實語毒消除。
translation: Craving, anger, ill-will, and delusion are the three poisons of the world, which the buddhas have all stopped and which the poison of true speech has eliminated.

source_sentence: 貪欲瞋恚癡，　　是世間三毒，　僧伽皆已斷，　　實語毒消除。
translation: Desire, anger, ill-will, and delusion are the three poisons of the world, which the saṃgha has all stopped and the poison of true speech has been removed.

source_sentence: 一切諸世尊，　　有大威神力，　羅漢具名稱，　　除毒令安隱。
translation: All the world-honored ones have great authority and spiritual power, and the arhats are called by name, which removes poison and makes them comfortable.

source_sentence: 我等并眷屬，　　常得離災厄，　願佛母明王，　　令一切安隱。」
translation: We and our retinue are always freed from calamity, so may the Buddha's mother, the luminous king, make all things peaceful."

source_sentence: 爾時具壽阿難陀，聞佛世尊說是經已，頂禮雙足，右繞三匝，承佛聖旨，往莎底苾芻所，便以此佛母大孔雀明王法，為彼苾芻而作救護，結其地界，結方隅界，攝受饒益，除其苦惱。
translation: After hearing the Bhagavān teach this sūtra, Kauṣṭhila Ānanda bowed his head at his feet, circled to his right three times, and according to the Buddha's noble command, went to the monk Sādhi and then used this teaching of the great peacock luminous king, the mother of buddhas, to rescue that monk, bind his earth realm and bind his directional realm, gather benefit, and remove his suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 時莎底苾芻，苦毒消散，身得安隱，從地而起，與具壽阿難陀，俱詣佛所，禮雙足已，在一面住。
translation: When the misery and poison had dissipated, the monk Sadī rose from the ground, went with Ananta for life, paid homage to both feet, and stayed to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告阿難陀：「由此因緣，汝當普告四眾——苾芻、苾芻尼、鄔波索迦、鄔波斯迦——及國王大臣世間人等，勸令一心受持此法，為他人說，書寫經卷，在處流通，當令嚴飾，建立壇場，香花飲食，隨分供養，令一切有情，離諸憂惱，得福無量，常獲安樂，壽命百年。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Ānanda, "For this reason, you must tell all four groups of people - the bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsaka, upāsikā - and the king's ministers and worldly people to encourage them to wholeheartedly accept this teaching, to teach it to others, to write down sūtra scrolls for circulation everywhere, to decorate them, to build altars, and to make offerings with flowers and food as appropriate, so that all sentient beings will be freed from sorrow and vexation, will attain immeasurable merit, will always be comfortable, and will have a life of a hundred years."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊說是經已，人天藥叉及諸鬼魅，奉佛教勅不敢違越，皆起慈心，護持經者。
translation: After the Bhagavān spoke this sūtra, the humans, gods, yakṣas, and demons who had been commanded by the Buddha not to transgress it all arose with kindness and protected the sūtra.

source_sentence: 時具壽阿難陀，及諸大眾，天、龍、藥叉、彥達嚩、阿蘇羅、摩嚕多、蘖嚕拏、緊那囉、摩護囉誐、人非人等，聞佛所說，皆大歡喜，信受奉行。
translation: Kauṣṭhila Ānanda and the rest of the assembly, gods, dragons, yakṣas, yandavas, asuras, mātṛgas, tilleras, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, humans, and nonhumans, all rejoiced when they heard what the Buddha taught, believed it, accepted, and approved.

source_sentence: 天阿蘇羅藥叉等，　　來聽法者應至心，　擁護佛法使長存，　　各各勤行世尊教。
translation: Asuras, yakṣas, and others in the heavens who come to hear the teaching should wholeheartedly guard the Buddha's teaching so that it will endure, and each will diligently apply the Bhagavān's teaching.

source_sentence: 諸有聽徒來至此，　　或在地上或居空，　常於人世起慈心，　　晝夜自身依法住。
translation: All those who come here listening, whether on earth or in space, always have compassion for the human world and abide by the Dharma themselves day and night.

source_sentence: 願諸世界常安隱，　　無邊福智益群生，　所有罪業並消除，　　遠離眾苦歸圓寂。
translation: May the worlds always be peaceful, limitless merit and wisdom benefit all sentient beings, all sins and actions are erased, and they are freed from suffering and return to perfect tranquility.

source_sentence: 恒用戒香塗瑩體，　　常持定服以資身，　菩提妙華遍莊嚴，　　隨所住處常安樂。
translation: He'll always coat his body with the scent of precepts, always wear the robe of meditation to nourish his body, and be adorned with the marvelous flowers of enlightenment, always at ease wherever he lives.
